modelrailway.railsystem

Class BaseFork

  • java.lang.Object
    • modelrailway.BaseObject
      • modelrailway.railsystem.BaseRail
        • modelrailway.railsystem.BaseRailPassable
          • modelrailway.railsystem.BaseFork
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CurveFork, TrippleFork

    public class BaseFork
extends BaseRailPassable
    This class describes the simplest available fork. One way over a curve and one way straight on.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Marco Endres & Simon Styger

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BaseFork(java.lang.String type)
      Constructor for a default fork.
      BaseFork(java.lang.String type, double radius, double angle, double length)
      Constructor for a non-default fork.

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean changeDirection(Direction newDirection)
      Changes the current direction on this fork an changes the way a train will take.

      Connects another rail to this rail.
      double getAngle()
      Returns the angle of the curve of this fork.
      BaseRail getConnectionC()
      Returns the baserail connected to point C.
      Direction getCurrentDirection()
      Returns the way a train will take if he will cross this fork.
      double getLength()
      Returns the effective length of this fork over the curve or over the straight way.

      Returns the length of the curve of this fork.
      double getLengthStraight()
      Returns the length of the straight part of this fork.

      Returns the radius of the curve of this fork.
      java.lang.String getType()

      • BaseFork

        public BaseFork(java.lang.String type)
        Constructor for a default fork.
        Parameters:
        type - defines if the curve on this fork goes to right or to left.

      • BaseFork

        public BaseFork(java.lang.String type,
        double radius,
        double angle,
        double length)
        Constructor for a non-default fork.
        Parameters:
        type - defines if the curve on this fork goes to right or to left.
        radius - defines the radius of the curve of this fork.
        angle - defines the angle of the curve of this fork.
        length - defines the length of the straight part of this fork.
